172
APPEALS
(1) Appeals against decrees of the court of first instance are permitted, unless otherwise determined by this Act.
(2) Appeals shall be submitted within fifteen days of the decree being served.
(3) An appeal shall stay the execution of a decree, unless the court decides otherwise.
(4) A court shall decide that an appeal does not stay the execution of a decree, particularly in cases where the decree orders that measures be taken in order to secure the estate and there is a danger that the postponement would make the execution of these measures impossible.
